Reviews.Title: Decent, But Not Great, Camera
Reviews.Author: larry the reviewer
Reviews.Content: I'm thinkin' 'bout buying a Nikon D-3100 as my "good" camera, and would appreciate any current owners' feedback.  In the meantime:OK, this is a long review, but I think it will tell you everything you want to know about the Kodak C1550, both Pro and Con, if you read the whole thing. I've had the camera since October 2011, long enough to make a fair assessment, I think.This review has been updated as of 6-12-2012.This is my first foray into the world of digital cameras. I have always shot FILM before, which I still think will take a higher quality picture if you have a good camera (and good lenses). But I liked the idea that I could just shoot and shoot without having to worry about running out of film. And digital is OK if you're not gonna blow something up to billboard size.  It can actually be pretty good.I wanted a small inexpensive camera that I could just strap to my belt and take along without a lot of bulk. To that extent, this camera has filled the bill. IMHO, it may not deserve a full four stars, but three stars would declare "It's OK", and it is a little better than OK. I would give it 3.5 stars. Here are my pros and cons:PRO'S:* COMPACT SIZE. I got a little Case Logic case to strap to my belt. Small, but big enough to hold the camera, USB cable (comes with the camera), spare batteries, and extra memory cards (if you need them). I can easily forget it's there on my belt.  But always at the ready; I take it everywhere.* EASE OF OPERATION. Contrary to other reviews, it really is pretty user friendly. Which is good, because it really doesn't come with much in the way of an Owner's Manual.  In fact the owner's manual SUX.  Just play around with it, and you'll figure it out quickly.The SMART CAPTURE setting is good for most pictures indoors or out, in normal light, although somtimes ya might wanna use the flash to "fill in" if you're in the shade outdoors.  You can set the flash so it's always on, but only do so when you need it in the shade, as it will affect batt life.  And get fairly close, cuz this flash has a really limited range.You can get some REALLY good low-light pics at night, if you use the low-light settings and a TRIPOD (use the DELAY settings so you're not touching the camera when it goes off). But DON'T HIT THE "FORMAT" BUTTON IF YOU HAVE PICTURES IN THE CAMERA! It will erase all your pictures.* EXTREMELY GOOD RESOLUTION FOR THE PRICE, at least under certain conditions. You have the option of shooting in 16MP in 4:3 aspect ratio, or 12MP in 16:9, which will fit a modern high def TV or computer screen. I have taken to shooting in 16:9 aspect, and it has an amazing degree of clarity, even when you zoom in. You can read a car license plate from 200' away, and that's just from the screen on the camera; if you upload to your computer and zoom, the distance from which you could see small details increases greatly.* EXTERNAL AA BATTERIES. I intended to buy a different Kodak model, one with INTERNAL batteries; glad I didn't. With an internal battery, when it runs down, you are DONE for the day. You CAN'T take the batt out and replace it. With external batteries, you just slap in another pair and keep shooting. I think this is something you should think about if you plan on taking a lot of pictures.* BATTERY LIFE. I bought TWO sets of RECHARGABLE NiMH batteries and an Eveready charger. I always carry at least one spare set of batts with me. But it will take a LOT of pics with one set. I shot over 500 pics with one set, and over 200 more after replacing (had more batt life, but I wore out before the second set of batts did).  So please don't listen to the detractors that say it has short batt life. I don't think most of them were using NiMH batts. And spend the money on a BATTERY CHARGER. It will save you lots of $$$ not only on the camera, but other devices you may have. I bought an Energizer charger which will charge AA's, AAA's, C's and also 9v!  Good value.*TAKES "OK" VIDEO. However, my particular Micorsoft program won't let me rotate videos, just stills. Consequently, I now have a pic of a Harrier jet taking off and landing sideways. But let's be realistic, the camera is mainly designed to take stills. If you're gonna shoot a lot of video, you need a dedicated video camera, or at least something that will shoot better video than this thing.  However, the AUDIO, considering it has a "pinhole" of a microphone, can be quite good.  Took it to a free concert in Austin (during SXSW) and videoed The Cult.  The sound, playing it back through a good sound system at home, was actually pretty amazing.  I filmed the Jumbotron, and the altogether video was pretty amazing; I was 100' away from the stage!* KODAK EASY SHARE SOFTWARE. This comes with the camera, and is great. When you're ready to upload to your computer, just plug it in and it automatically puts the pictures in your existing picture library or other destination if you prefer.  Kodak went bankrupt, of course, so they no longer support their EasyShare website.  So, after downloading to your computer, you can upload to Shutterfly, the company to which they transferred the existing pic's of all of us current users. You can also share via Facebook, Twitter, and a variety of other places. The Gallery is great, because now you can access your Galleries from any computer ANYWHERE; all you need is your email address and password.  I'm not happy with one aspect of Shutterfly.  The Kodak site would let you post an "intro" to each album you upload; Shutterfly's site apparently does not.  However, you can still caption any individual picture you want to. There is a CON, to the Easy Share system, which I will get to in the Con's.*Update, 6-12-2012: Kodak is transferring ALL (and my) photo galleries to Shutterfly.com, presumably intact, as of July 2nd.  I'll let ya know how that goes.  Hey, please ALWAYS keep your permanent photo files on your local hard drive, or trustble backup.CON'S:* SPEED OF FOCUSING. I will agree with the reviewers that say the camera is slow to focus. Mine is sort of cantankerous. Sometimes it will focus quickly, sometimes it will focus slowly. And if I'm trying to do a Macro (closeup), sometimes it will not focus at all.  I've experimented with pushing the shutter button down halfway and giving the camera time to auto focus, or just "point and shoot", and in a lot of cases, no difference in quality of picture.  But if you have the time, use the time to auto focus.UPDATE: After using this camera for awhile, I found that you can take some really high-resolution closups if you DO NOT USE THE ZOOM very much and get as close to the subject as possible without the Zoom.  I caught a lizard with it, and you can literally count the scales!  And a bird in my front yard and, well, you get the idea.I have owned a really good Canon EOS Rebel film camera in the past, and it's not fair to compare this cheap lil' Kodak camera to something approaching professional-grade. But even at thet, it really could be better at focusing quickly, even considering the low price. All-in-all, it's tolerable. To me, at least. If you're in doubt about a picture, take a couple more. You're not gonna run out of memory, after all.* SENSITIVITY TO MOTION. I took a cross-country train trip recently, and had a fair amount of trouble getting unblurred pictures when the train was moving and rocking back and forth, especially when trying to shoot a subject INSIDE the train; it did better on landscapes out the window. Again, it's an inexpensive camera, so you have to temper your expectations with that fact.*NO AUDIO WITH VIDEO WHEN PLAYING BACK ON THE CAMERA. Once you upload to your computer, you will have sound. To be fair, the manual says it HAS a speaker in the camera, so it's possible mine was defective. Again, something I can live with it that's the case. How good is the sound gonna be from a 1/8" speaker anyway? If anyone buys one of these and the sound in the camera works, please shoot me a response.*UPDATE: Several other owners of this camera have responded to me, that their cameras also would not play back audio on their cameras, so this must be how they designed them.  Hey, at best you'd be listening to playback through a 1/8" speaker, so if that's what you want.  But it still is a bit annoying that Kodak even lists "speaker" as a component in the camera when the speaker doesn't even WORK.  Please refer to other comments in the review.*KODAK EASY SHARE SOFTWARE. Of course, and already mentioned your pictures would now go to Shutterfly if you choose, there is no longer an EasyShare website, even though the camera still has the software in it.  One strange thing I noticed: I had to download new software when the transition from EasyShare to Shutter happened (to my camera).  The camera USED to have the option of taking pictures in Black & White or Sepia.  After doing the recommended download, those settings disappeared.  I have no idea why the decided to omit those, or if it was just an oversight.  Either way, it would have been nice to still have those choices available.Bottom line: If you want a GREAT camera, spend the bucks on a better camera. If you want a decent camera that will perform most of the functions that us "regular" folks need, this camera will suffice. I didn't have the time to do a lot of shopping; I needed one for an air show (Miramar) the next day. I trusted that Kodak would make a camera I could live with, and that's what I got. If you have the time, sure, do some shopping around. But I will say that this little camera takes really good pictures most of the time. I'm overall happy with the results. And since I have it already, I'm gonna live with the imperfections it has. I intend to buy a larger, closer-to-professional-grade camera (with a bigger lens and optical AND digital zoom) for those occasions when I'm more concerned about quality than portability. But this little camera goes a lot of places with me, and will continue to do so.Again, I give it 3.5 stars. It's better than just OK, and I do pretty much like it, although it does have its limitations.I really wish I could share with you some of the pictures I have taken with this camera, both portraits and landscapes, so you can get an idea of what you can do with this camera.  But Amazon doesn't seem to accomodate for that, or at least I don't know how to do it.This camera will take some pretty good pictures, even great picures under the right conditions.Hope you find this DETAILED review helpful.

Reviews.Title: Easy and takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: kmzad
Reviews.Content: This a really nice camera for the price. Decent optical zoom and 16 mp all for $89 shipped is a good deal. It's easy to point and shoot for good looking pics. It also takes regular double A batteries that you can get anywhere so that is a plus although it does seem to go through the batteries a little quicker than other cameras we've owned. All things considered it was a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M Cortright
Reviews.Content: I absolutley love the Kodak Easyshare C1550 camera. It is small enough to fit easily in my pocket. The viewing screen is nice and large, it takes a sequence of pictures rapidly. The pictures apear on the computer screen with much clarity and it takes regular AA batteries and normal memory cards.

Reviews.Title: HATE this camera
Reviews.Author: Commotion
Reviews.Content: After breaking my much loved Easy share C182, needed a replacement quick and picked up the C1550.  I own a consignment riding clothes store and use my camera to take pictures of the clothing.  A must is accurate color and close up pictures of the texture.  This camera is so hard to make any settings on, it won't keep your setting ,you have to change it before every picture and it made the pictures so pixellated (( guess that is the problem), the fabric of the clothing would look wavy in the pictures.  Makes me look very unprofessional.  Never so disapointed in a camera.

Reviews.Title: VERY slow to focus
Reviews.Author: Da Da Gary
Reviews.Content: Purchased this, our 4th Kodak Easy Share camera, to replace an aging M1033 10 megapixel camera that worked absolutely great, but recently developed a problem with the memory card popping out randomly at inopportune times.I don't think we've been able to take a decent photo with the C1550.  The auto focus is horrendously slow, and by the time the camera decides it is focused and snaps the picture, the subject (usually our 2 young boys) has moved and thus the photo is out of focus and blurry.  This is not a problem we have with any of our other cameras, including our cell phones.The other complaint I have is the M1033 came with a rechargeable lithium ion battery that held a charge for a long time.  This camera requires the use of 2 AA size batteries.  That is great as far as availability, but the battery life with alkaline batteries is about 30 photos and the camera goes from seemingly having enough power to dead without any warning.  I recently purchased some lithium AA batteries, but haven't had them in the camera long enough to know if they will make enough of a difference to justify the price.So I have to say I am very disappointed in this camera because I had extremely high hopes that it would take even better photos than our old M1033.  But now it seems we may be better off just living with the memory card problem of the M1033.

Reviews.Title: Ok for general picture taking But point and shoot too slow.
Reviews.Author: S. M. Sachs
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras brand new for a month long trip to Europe for my wife and I. Together we shot over 8,000 pictures. When we wanted to take pictures on a moving bus or train or quick action photos either the camera would'nt shoot or the pictures came out not in focus. We experimented with every setting and still found both cameras performed poorly. The auto focus is too slow! For still subjects or landscapes our results were better. The resolution was good. Low light non flash performance was good most of the time an battery life good with 2000 milliamp hour rechargables (200 pics). We both used a 16 gig SD card and as the SD card filled with picture data the boot up time increased. We erased after download to solve that proplem For general picture taking this camera is ok but for fast boot, point and shoot we both found this camera to be a big disappointment :(

Reviews.Title: Poor quality camera
Reviews.Author: aria
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on Sept. 23, 2011. It broke on Nov. 14, 2011.  Before we get into that, though, I have to talk about the picture quality.  At 16 mp, I expected a lot better quality.  I did not get it.  A lot of moving pics turned out blurry, even when set to the proper mode.  The low light settings were also terrible.  But I dealt with it because I needed a cheap camera.  I knew what I paid, so I didn't complain.  For almost $100, I will complain about it breaking, however.Less than 2 months after buying it, the lens stopped working.  When I turn the camera on, the screen says "Lens obstructed."  When I spoke with Kodak customer service, I of course was asked if it had been dropped or exposed to liquid or heat.  It has not ever been any of those things.  At the same time I was talking to customer service, I was doing some research online.  I found out that little sand particles or other tiny debris can get into any part of the lens and obstruct it.  This is not terribly uncommon for most cameras.  What shocked me was that Kodak would not quite me a price, or even tell me if debris was covered under my warranty.  They just wanted me to send it in.  Luckily, I found out online that it is NOT covered under the warranty, so I expected to be charged for it.  Upon further investigation, I found out that they wanted more money for the repair than the camera was worth.  If they couldn't fix it at all, they would send me a "refurbished" camera.  That may not even be the same model.  If I didn't respond to the emailed quote within 30 days, they would "dispose" of my camera.  Really?  Dispose of it?  I wonder how they get all those refurbished cameras to send out?My conclusion is that I cannot recommend staying away from this camera enough.  Not only this camera in particular, but the Kodak brand itself.  Which is a shame.  There was a time when the name Kodak was synonymous with quality.  Sadly, that is no longer true.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Jericho
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! I am a teenager, and cant live without a camera to take pictures of my fun times at school, so this camera is great to carry around wherever I go! I love the fact that it is purple (my school color)! Also, it takes great artistic shots too, which is great for my photography class! Overall just a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Likes Quality
Reviews.Content: This camera makes uploads to your computer, Facebook, CVS and a few other sites simultaneously if that's what you want. It's a handy feature that saves a lot of time. Picture quality in most instances if wonderful for the casual picture taker and it's a convenient size to grab and go. Would not recommend it for somebody who is looking for a serious photo shoot though.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon Heald
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. Takes great pictures, easy to use. Tried canon and nikon,and found them to be complicated and took lousy pictures. Especially canon.

Reviews.Title: Plain  & simple
Reviews.Author: T-REX
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures, easy to use. It uses 2-AA batt. which you can just carry a spare set if your going where you can't charge thecamera back up which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan
Reviews.Author: David Sanders
Reviews.Content: This camera has terrible battery life, takes forever to focus and the settings are terrible.  If you plan on picking one up, don't forget to grab a large pack of batteries..

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: nikki kael
Reviews.Content: great present we purchesed for my 13 yr old daughter who is interested in photography. takes great pics, and it came in her favorite color...purple.

Reviews.Title: CHEAP! and pretty good pixels!
Reviews.Author: J. Bertulfo "JayBee"
Reviews.Content: If you need a simple camera that is decent then this product will suffice your needs. By no means will this replace DSLR camera's or be better than the expensive ones out there. Other reviews have already pointed out the short comings of this camera. But if you need a camera to keep in your car in case of emergencies, then look no further. Great price for the functions its called upon to do... take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera around August and have taken pictures in a few states with it and on another continent, as I travel a lot.  I am happy with the value and picture quality.  It is not the best camera I have ever had for taking random pictures while a vehicle is moving, but if you take the time, it will deliver a good shot.

Reviews.Title: Problem Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Schmitt "Big Lou"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a complete failure.  It worked for a short time about 15 minutes than it shut down with a low battery light flashing.  I replaced the batteries that came with the camera with brand new Duracel batteries but it still did the same thing.  This is the 3rd Kodak camera our family have owned that has had problems. Amazon did a good job returning the camera and crediting our credit card.  We than bought a Sony camera which works great.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Hailey Mills "Pollyanna"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son who is disabled and has use of only one hand as well as the problem of being unable to keep his other hand from shaking.  This camera takes absolutely beautiful pictures with no blurring from shaking the camera!A must buy itme.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C1550 16 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: stringfrenzy
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of the Kodak line and of the easyshare series then this is the camera for you.  Very user friendly and takes great pictures.  Not a bad camera at all for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, camera takes Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: clo21
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because I had a model very similar in the past and loved it.  It came at a great price, and the images are excellent quality.  It is capable of catching clear good quality images of a very busy toddler on the move.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars, is because with my previous model, it was much easier to change all the setting options.  Each time I try to switch off automatic mode to one of the specialized modes (like backlight, or motion shot) I have a difficult time figuring out how to do so.

Reviews.Title: Super Camera
Reviews.Author: Shorty Caison
Reviews.Content: The best camera I have ever purchased for such an affordable price. The menu is easy to navigate even for a beginner. The camera takes great pics and is easy to down load to your computer.

Reviews.Title: Plain and Simple
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I've had three Easyshare cameras now.  I do a lot of hiking and my last one lasted 6 years bouncing around in my backpack.  I thought this was excellent.  This present camera I am quite happy with as it has most of the same features as the old one but has nearly 10 more megapixels than the old one.  So far so good!

Reviews.Title: Second One I Bought
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Nickle
Reviews.Content: I just broke my first Kodak Easy Share C1550...went to look for another and find out Kodak won't be making them any long, but I'm thrilled that I found some for sale here on Amazon.comI love the camera...takes nice pictures, simple to use and I can carry it wherever I go.  I hope this one last long time...guess I'll have to keep my kitty away from it.

Reviews.Title: Easy share ?
Reviews.Author: J. Fox "gma quilter"
Reviews.Content: The easy share is easy after you figure it out, butI did not keep the camera because I have pretty bad arthritis in my hands and because of the small size of the camera it was too difficult for me to use it.  Otherwise a good product for the money

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: nccookie231 "nccookie231"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.  It's easy to operate and just the right size.  I loved to purple color.  I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: LDM
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I purchased this Kodak camera. I just wanted a small camera that I could carry around in my purse. I made a great choice. I love this camera!!

Reviews.Title: I am in love with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Breanna
Reviews.Content: I really fell in love with this camera when I was looking at reviews on it and seen some of the pictures it took and video quality. I have to keep my eyes on this little baby because my family and boyfriend tries to steal it lol But this is a great camera, not bulky and the quality is just amazing! Also before you take pictures the cool thing is you can change how many MP you want the picture to contain...even though it does say 16 MP. Your picture doesn't necessarily have to be that good of a quality even though I don't know who would want to change the awesome quality 16 MP has lol. I would recommend this product to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Norma
Reviews.Content: This purchase was to replace my old Kodak camera that I had purchased 8 yrs. ago.  This camera is a great replacement & I am very satisfied with the pictures I am taking.

Reviews.Title: Loved this so bought some for relatives
Reviews.Author: Terri "Terri"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera as our cell phone didn't have very good quality video and was very slow on capturing any picture-worthy events.  Love that its 16MP which is higher than my professional grade DSLR.  The video setting is very good quality.  The picture setting is also great and puts out some excellent shots.We decided to buy this for my parents and my husband's mom.  My parents are a little tech savvy so they had no problem with the camera.  My husband's mom is very non tech savvy so takes some time with figuring out the camera and somehow the flash no longer works on her camera.  Fully charged batteries and a reset of the camera and still no flash.Our camera got dropped a few times thanks to our now 19 month old, therefore it is no longer in working condition and no longer usable.  Will be looking around for a high MP camera that can withstand a 19 month old.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Brian Newberry "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: Does most tasks as advertised (& quite well).Weak point:  Low light conditions - images come out grainy & dark.  This might seem obvious, but some cameras can compensate nicely; Kokak 1550 not so much.  But this isn't a deal-breaker.

Reviews.Title: Dying batteries
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and took it on vacation.  The batteries die every few minutes.  I tried all different batteries and had no luck.  It is the worst camera I could have bought.  Only got to take one or two pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't focus
Reviews.Author: SeanL.
Reviews.Content: I got the thing and it never did focus. I contacted Kodak and they would fix it under warranty, if I paid to send the damn thing in. Sorry, but if it didn't work right, from the start, it's not MY responsibility to pay for shipping. It's yours. I'll just cut my losses and buy a Nikon or Canon. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great Kodak
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Y Dungee
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love Kodak products and have not been disappointed bythis great pix taking camera.  Dependable, great battery performanceand awesome pixs.  Highly recommend to anyone who loves to takesphotos as I do.  Happy picture taking!!!

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: giancarlosmom
Reviews.Content: This camera is very flimsy.  We were only able to use it once.  We took 5 pictures and died.  Not worth it at half the price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Caroline Connor
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I am sorry they are not making this model anymore.  Best camera I ever had.  Super easy to use and download into my computer.  I carry one in my purse  as much as I can.  You never know when you will see something special.

Reviews.Title: Good option similarities to smartphone
Reviews.Author: Wendi Humphryes
Reviews.Content: Due to compact size and full view back, this model is a lot like a smartphone in a camera.  It is a little slippery, easy to drop.  Godd Thing I purchased the Accidental Protection Plan, just in case.  I think I received black instead of blue, but It wasn't important enough to return.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: lycia solsman
Reviews.Content: This camera so easy to use for my 8 year old granddaughter. She loves it and it is very durable

Reviews.Title: kodak
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: great camera great pics been using this now for couple of years and I am very satisfied  with this purchase

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ed Waller
Reviews.Content: Recommed this camera to all.Takes great pictures. Don't have to charge batteries. Just put in new batteries when needed. Batteries are common available everywhere. Simple to move pictures from camera to computer.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: Got this one to replace my 10 year old predecessor of the same camera and am pretty happy with it. The auto focus setting blurs easily if your subject is moving and there is a short delay when you press the button before the picture is taken, otherwise no complaints. I love that you can take pictures in sepia and black and white right on the camera without having to photo shop them later for the effect.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Haven Devine - Premier Contracting
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this camera before for our construction crew to take job photos, when a friend needed a new camera, I bought this one for her.  She loves it!  Easy to use and great photos.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: S. White "SWhite"
Reviews.Content: Love it but it should come with a camera bag!!  Sometime when looking at the back of the camera it looks like I see purple lines but it doesn't show on the picture.  Not sure if something is wrong with the camera or if that is how it is made......

Reviews.Title: Disappointed With How Sharing Works
Reviews.Author: J. Wright
Reviews.Content: The easy share button should probably be called easier to share. Once you take a picture, you can assign it to email, facebook, youtube, etc. The problem is, you have to connect it to your computer for the sharing to actually take place.I'm used to the Eyefi cards that have built in wifi to automatically send the picture as soon as it is taken. EasyShare is not like that.

Reviews.Title: Battery hog
Reviews.Author: Pamela E. Stanley
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the battery situation...you cannot plug it in to charge.  Went through batteries that came with camera in just 4 hours.  Also, I thought the picture quality was poor...mainly the color and flash.

Reviews.Title: Kodak 16 MP camera
Reviews.Author: Tony BRILEY
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, easy to use camera. Pictures are sharp and very clear. Would highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Kokinda
Reviews.Content: I had this same exact camera but it broke and wanted another one as I heard Kodak would not be manufacturing anymore camera's due to it filing bankruptcy. So happy to have found one..

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: jayne crockett
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to have a backup for the Easyshare I already have.  Love the price, ease of operation, and quality of the photos I get with this camera.  Seller delivered on time.  Would highly recommend camera and seller.

Reviews.Title: Good price great camera.
Reviews.Author: kenneth m bennett
Reviews.Content: I have had several Kodak cameras for my business. The C1550 makes great photos for the money. My employees lose them and I just buy a newer model. Great lens and zoom. Buy an SD card and tripod and you are ready.

Reviews.Title: Stock up on AA batteries!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Quintanilla
Reviews.Content: The product produces descent pictures, however, it burns through batteries.  In the future I would buy a rechargeable camera that can charge by being connected to my computer.  Saves on the additional cost of batteries.

Reviews.Title: vacations
Reviews.Author: vernito
Reviews.Content: This little camera is good. It took nice pics and videos.  It was a good purchase.  I got it 2yrs ago and it still preforms like new.

Reviews.Title: Not the same
Reviews.Author: Jean Nelson
Reviews.Content: I had an Easyshare camera for quite a while but the battery compartment recently broke. I bought the EasyShare 1550 as a replacement. Really disappointed! The picture quality is not good at all and it is not compatible with my computer recognizing it. I take lots of pictures of my school activities and will not be able to use a large majority of the pics! The only way to upload the pictures to my computer is to take the SD card out and insert it into the computer. I feel as if I have wasted $$$$.

Reviews.Title: The name says it all "EASY"
Reviews.Author: dAVE
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and takes great pictures.  I have more expensive cameras, but always grab this for ease of use and the refresh time between shoots. You can rapid fire shoots (like when the little ones are blowing out candles or your son is going to make that touchdown).  You can quick shot again and again, and the pictures are good, time and time again.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: ariona_lie
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my 14 year old daughter - it take great and clear picutres - wich it had an internal charger ( I know thats not possible) but overall I love this camera and would deffinately reccommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C1550
Reviews.Author: agrandmotherslegacy
Reviews.Content: This is my second Easyshare cameraI have an older version as well. I have had good results withboth. I am not a professional photographer but this meetsthe needs of what I do with a camera {family photos, eBayselling etc,} the only complaint I have is I do wish pics could besnapped more quickly with less delay between but I guess aperson would need to purchase a more expensive camera forthat. Over all I love this camera it gives me good results and isnot complicated to operate

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare (Blue)
Reviews.Author: B. Torres "BLT"
Reviews.Content: My old Kodak brand camera broke after I dropped it and I really needed a new camera to use for our next vacation. I found this one online and after reading the reviews, I decided to purchase it. My previous one which was also an "easy share" was a lot simpler to use. I still can't figue out how to take a picture with/without a flash! Also, I can't stand that this camera works on AA batteries vs. the rechargable kind. I've gone through packs of batteries after just taking a couple of pictures. I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy Camera
Reviews.Author: Joyful Reader
Reviews.Content: I love my Kodak Easyshare C1550!  I have 3 other cameras and do not want to spend my picture-taking time adjusting everything and then don't get a good picture anyway.  With the Kodak Easyshare C1550, I just point and click!

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: H. Kindred
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace another Easyshare that I dropped.  Oops.  It came in time for a trip to Zermatt Switzerland and gave us a bunch or very nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Cecilia Dillon
Reviews.Content: Bad focus, mediocre quality images, doesn't do well unless everything is perfectly lit, flash isn't worth crap, and  the "share" feature doesn't work with any programs.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement for old Kodak digital
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, it has a lot of bells and whistles I haven't tried yet as I am a point and shoot type but most of the shots I take are nice and clear and easy to edit.  Hard to use outdoors because viewfinder gets lost in sunlight.I have the same problem with this unit as I did w/my first Kodak digital - my computer won't recognize it when I plug it in, kees telling me camera is not conected so I have to use the thingy that reads the memory card once you take it out of the camera. Annoying but it works.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Erickson
Reviews.Content: We're very happy with the Kodak we purchased from Amazon. More than what we expected.  We will probably buy another.

Reviews.Title: Good inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Monty Alford
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures for an inexpensive camera. No problems just point and shoot. Delivered sooner than expected. Tracking was not so good but for the price OK.

Reviews.Title: Excellent easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph D. Thomas jr
Reviews.Content: This was a refurbished model and it has performed perfectly!!  Got some great vivid shots of 4th of July boom booms.  For less than 60 bucks you simply cant beat it.  Nice bright display and many options for shooting all sorts of shots.  Excellent beginner camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy download
Reviews.Author: Samuel Augustus Jennings "Samuel Augustus Jen...
Reviews.Content: Photo quality is good for the price and photos download easily to my Apple computer. This is a good deal and I highly recommend this camera.  Too bad Kodak dropped out.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Edward Kirven
Reviews.Content: Ok camera to own and it works just as described and easy to use for picture taking and nice color.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and it did not cost a arm and a leg  to get it, I like having Amazon at my finger tips  to order stuff. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: treschicresale
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, however It does not come with a battery charger. It is easy to use. I love my kodak cameras.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Nobie
Reviews.Content: I needed a new kodak camera because my old one broke and the kodak c1550 came in perfect handy i love it takes great pix near and far

Reviews.Title: Still a Good Buy, even without Kodak Support
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: We chose this camera based on an excellent track record with similar Kodak cameras. We have never needed tech support, so we didn't care that Kodak was phasing out their camera division and would no longer have support available. This camera is easy to use and takes great  pictures, and it fits easily in a purse or pocket. For people who prefer a camera to a camera phone, this one is good. I don't know what we'll do at the end of its life...

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Judy Nail
Reviews.Content: I love my little Kodak Easyshare  C1551 (Blue ) camera. I really hate that one of the oldest American companies has gone out of business! A sign of the times!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Dennis Seltsam
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Replaced a water damaged camera that was very similar. Fits in my shirt pocket for quick use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for everyday use.
Reviews.Author: amanda kell
Reviews.Content: Good camera for everyday use. Some of the special settings (such as low light) do not work very well. Camera is great for well lit stationary pictures

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C1550
Reviews.Author: Peggy Burdick
Reviews.Content: This is a fun-to-use camera, easy to hold, and takes lovely pics. Haven't figured out how to download and view the video recordings on my iPad but, other than that, it's a sweet little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Erik Sell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a deployment to Afghanistan.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money on this camera becasue the environment over here is tough on electronics.  This carmera has held up well under the circumstances and takes good pictures.  FOr the price, I don't think you can wrong with this camera if you are looking for a small camera to travel with that take decent pics.  Only critisim so far is i wish it had a better zoom, but agian for the price I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Defective, and customer service was not helpful
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I have an earlier model Kodak Easyshare which I really liked, but this one will not properly read or format the memory card (tried 3 different ones). What was particularly frustrating was my on-line chat with their customer support. The person on the other end was friendly enough, but it seemed like she was either clueless or not paying attention. For example, I said at the outset it was a C1550 that I bought on Amazon. About 30 secs later, she writes, "What model is it and where did you buy it?" Then she tells me to reset the camera, which we did twice, and 15 minutes later she asks, "Have we tried resetting the camera?" She went round and round in circles and finally, after 45 mins when I said I had to go, she said (direct quote from screen):  "As this is an issue with the product it need to send it for repair."  In short, defective camera and seemingly unqualified help person.

Reviews.Title: Pixels
Reviews.Author: Stephen G. Shapiro "Son Comte"
Reviews.Content: Too many pixels.  Any camera capturing more than 10 pixels will make for a fuzzy enlargement.  But, it serves its purpose.  A keeper.

Reviews.Title: Good!
Reviews.Author: psuzannes
Reviews.Content: No sound on video. If there can't easily find it.Takes great pictures.Easy to download.Don't use "share" feature but seems easy.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera !  Never wait for your camera to charge again with this AA battery operated camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Klein
Reviews.Content: GREAT camera !  With AA batteries, I never have to miss a "Kodak moment" again, because there's no charging the camera - it works on batteries !!  Great idea !!  Great photos!!  Easy to use (even if you don't read the instructions - I didn't).

Reviews.Title: It's a decent start up camera
Reviews.Author: Christa Watson
Reviews.Content: It's nice as a start up camera. I like the way it takes pictures overall. The only thing I don't like is that it's a little slow on pics but other than that, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare c1550 camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen Brown
Reviews.Content: So far it is great.  I have not read all of the instructions yet on the available options, yet but so far, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Love all the features and the quality of pictures it takes. The battery cover chipped after only a few times of opening and closing but it hasn't affected the cameras ability to keep the batteries in place so I'm not too worried about it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jill Harris
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace my old and outdated Kodak Easyshare. Love this camera! Would definitely recommend and would buy again.  As always, fast shipping from Amazon. It's great to be a Prime member

Reviews.Title: Easyshare is Easy to use
Reviews.Author: RJY
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kodak Easyshare camera,  it is easy to use and takes great pics!  Great value, for the price,

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but had to send for repairs
Reviews.Content: We go through a lot of cameras so I don't like to spend a lot of money on them. I purchased this one and within a week got a "lens obstructed" error. After a few minutes, the camera righted itself and worked good for a few more weeks, but then I got the same error and this time it wouldn't fix itself.  I did some research and come to find out it's a common error.  I called Kodak, they told me to send the camera to a repair facility and that if it was covered under warranty it would get repaired; otherwise, I would be told the cost for the repair.  Having read other reviews, I expected that I would have to pay to repair. Fortunately, I did not. Within a week I got an email letting me know that they would be fixing the camera at no cost. A few days later the camera arrived. I was without a camera for about a week and a half, but it seems to be working ok so far.  I like the AA batteries (don't have to remember to recharge) and it's quick to take pictures. I have a Nikon that's twice the price that takes twice as long to take a picture. Good camera if it doesn't break down on you.

Reviews.Title: Happy with camera
Reviews.Author: Larry G. Teckmeyer
Reviews.Content: good deal! came fast, works great!Happy with bright display!Works better than I had hoped!Recommend anyone buying this!

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: Mark Thaler
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is so easy to use and defintely  a real winner. It takes fantastic pictures and the viewing screen is nice and lalrge.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for simplicity.

Reviews.Title: Unprofessional and Unfreindly
Reviews.Author: lisab22
Reviews.Content: The seller came off as discourteous. The camera is in good condition, nothing special and it does not let you review your photos in any way other than thumbnails. I would not do business with this seller again. I do not recommend

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Baird
Reviews.Content: Works well, bought for my daughter for 4H photography.  Easy for her to use.  We can't find the volume buttons though for video.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: Its easy to use and takes great pictures i love the face regicintion feature and the share button makes it so easy to share my pictures with my family and friends on facebook i really love this camera

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera to carry and take your pictures of the people you love. The image is amazing and they print out well
Reviews.Author: Jesus
Reviews.Content: The image is fantastic and the pictures come out lovely. I love how there is the easy share button to share the photos with your family and friends on facebook.

Reviews.Title: Finally! A regular camera
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Great uncomplicated ease of use camera for us non-techies.  Pictures are sharp and color is great.  I had another Kodak Easy Share C875 that I LOVED but it finally died on me.  Prior to finding this C1550 I purchased two other different cameras, but returned both because I didn't want a camera you need an electronics degree to operate..just a camera that will take good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "EAJ"
Reviews.Content: Certainly worth the $.  Hard to figure out how to use it, though.  Takes fairly good pictures, and the video has great sound with it!Took it on vacation - got some great shots. Wish it came with a manual.

Reviews.Title: Great 1st time Camera
Reviews.Author: Sheri Dreghorn
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the first time user. The big 3" screen and easy functions are great. Easy to use, just point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Emmanuell
Reviews.Content: Esta en excelentes condiciones, sin ningún detalle. Recomiendo este vendedor, sus artículos llegan en el tiempo estimado y son aún mejor que lo descrito.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded Camera
Reviews.Author: gishack
Reviews.Content: This is the upgrade from my old 8.2 Kodak. Cost less than my older one (M853) 1/2 as much as a matter of fact. Love the larger display. Would have been nice to have the internal battery like the old one. Just placed rechargable ones in it and rotate them when needed. overall great product.

Reviews.Title: EasyShare--Easy Use. What a Specimen.
Reviews.Author: Talltalent
Reviews.Content: Historically, from my family's standpoint, I have been the principal photographer at social events. I remember well my Instamatic 104, and the many pictures and slides I yet have to reminisce over. This EasyShare C1550 enables me to capture quite an array of still and live action. Price-wise, the cost through Amazon--again, was fantastic. Thanks to having this gem on hand, I was able to capture a few photos of a wild turkey that trekked onto my front lawn. What a specimen--the turkey, and the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Duane K Swarts
Reviews.Content: The Kodak C1550 takes great pictures (stills & videos) and is easy to use and carry so is available for those once in a lifetime pics.  I especially like to use Rechargable AA Batteries as I take myriads of pics and select the ones to keep and store on my computer or external storage for much viewing enjoyment many times later.

Reviews.Title: False Advertising by Kodak
Reviews.Author: C. Shafer "Craft-a-holic"
Reviews.Content: Kodak has deleted all of the share services offered other than Facebook, Wal-Mart and CVS. The camera has a Manage Picture Frames option under the Share Button but there was no documentation on it with the camera or online so I emailed Kodak to inquire and this was the response I received."As per the camera model you provided C1550 Manage Picture Frames option does not exist in this camera model. Please confirm the camera model and if you provided the correct camera model then we are unable to find the option you mentioned."Obviously Kodak doesn't know their own cameras and this camera doesn't do what it says it does. I'm returning mine immediately.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought the product for my husband, and he has used it and used it! He will take a picture, and it doesn't even need much editing.  Its a newer camera than mine, and I love it too.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mata Dennis
Reviews.Content: This was bought for a day care and the teachers are finding it easy to take quick pictures of the children.

Reviews.Title: bery whell
Reviews.Author: eudy ernesto pena canario
Reviews.Content: just i dont like tha they have just 300 mb internal but i take i picture very whell  like I was spected

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: HISSIFITZ "EZ WRITER"
Reviews.Content: I'M NOT A CAMERA PERSON, SO THIS CAMERA WAS JUST RIGHT FOR ME.  EASY TO LEARN AND EASY TO USE.

Reviews.Title: absolutely a keeper
Reviews.Author: Tammy ellis
Reviews.Content: i had a black kdak easy share which was my first digital i got when i finally brokedown and gave up my film cameras and oh boy don't know how i lived without one and this is so easy to use i have arthritus really bad in my hands and is hard to grip and hang onto things but this kodak easy share is wounderful  i even had a much larger camera for closer views by fuji and always went back to this one in nov. my house was robbed and they got all my cameras and electronics ect. i was heart broken and lost without my cameras and tried to look everywhere for a new kodak easy share when i found out that kodak was discontinuing several items including my printer and ink so when i found my almost the same but blue which i like better i love blue  kodak easyshare on amozon i was soo excited thankyou thankyou thankyou i am happy was again have already gone through 3 (4mg) sd cards taking pictures thats why i chose to select a five star rating it is really simple for people that are old school products and and small enough to fit in a pocket or purse/back-pack/diaper bag ect you gotta get one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for everyday pictures
Reviews.Author: Carlita S. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I made my choice of purple because it's flashy and not too many people have purple cameras. I chose this specific camera because it is easy to use and loved the panoramic feature.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use. Nice in bright areas and natural light.  Not so great in low light or night time.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C1550 purchase
Reviews.Author: Sheila Ridlehoover
Reviews.Content: It arrived on time and works just as well as a new one! I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kreedie
Reviews.Content: I have not had any problems with this camera. Takes great pictures. Love the color. So far so good. To bad they are discontinuing kodak.

Reviews.Title: works grate (it's for the kids)
Reviews.Author: ofer fridman
Reviews.Content: bought it for the kids, the results pictures are OK,Very simple to use. the kids have much fun.Grate buy.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Lisa Boggs
Reviews.Content: small, great to tuck away  while traveling or hang from your belt, love the smart capture and easy share, this is the second one I have ordered in 6 months. I got one to replace the first easy share we had had for years, we just wore it out. Liked this model so well, I ordered this blue one for my husband for Christmas, I got the purple for myself, no trouble's at all, so far with anything.

Reviews.Title: one of the few
Reviews.Author: Mark D Hyjek
Reviews.Content: one of the few that does a time and date stamp on the photo. wegive out many of these to our people to use.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: EdmundOldGuy "Relearning Old Guy"
Reviews.Content: No fuzz camera.  Just point and shoot.  No need to be an expert.  No need to read any manual.  As long as you know how to frame your picture, it is a simple click and you are done.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera and it was exactly as advertized.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a camera with regular batteries.

Reviews.Title: performance
Reviews.Author: Sonia Solomon "sunshiny"
Reviews.Content: i am really enjoying the experience of using this camera - it gives me clear and beautiful pictures and is very easy to use.  i love the size and weight and overall i believe i want to purchase a few more for my children want to take mine away from me

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't own any other
Reviews.Author: Linda Bowman
Reviews.Content: Like this camera very much for its very easy to use, in fact its the second one like it that I've owned because my husband dropped my first one and broke it. lol

Reviews.Title: Kodak C1550
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Lucas
Reviews.Content: The camera meet my expectations. It used normal batteries (2-AA cells), was small and light, had many features, was at a very attractive price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Got it for my husband as a Christmas gift, and it takes wonderful pictures!! Definitely recommend this camera, we love it.

Reviews.Title: No printer port
Reviews.Author: SpeedyG
Reviews.Content: I would like it to sit it on my Kodak photo printer with bottom port that quickly prints pics without having to deal with the computer! I would have thought that ALL Kodak Easyshares would hve that bottom port!!!  very dissapointing!! considering my other Easyshare stopped working for no reason & that's why I bought this one!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Marie Schenk
Reviews.Content: This camera hasn't been used much yet, since it was purchased for a Christmas gift, but it arrived quickly and in good condition and I'm sure we will enjoy it

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: carol hamiton
Reviews.Content: I am still getting used to the camera, it does so many things. But it takes beautiful pictures, clear and bright.

Reviews.Title: Easy, great photos, convenient..what's not to like?
Reviews.Author: Kathryn M. Novelli "Luckycat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera early this year and have had nothing but great experiences using it.  Very nice pictures, takes great videos and is so easy to use.  I don't 'get' the negatives...for me, it's a great little camera.  Definitely recommend...runs on two double A batteries and works great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: William Allard "boatman bill"
Reviews.Content: Easy to choose and great for us to use and become familiar with. Would order again for a gift if needed

Reviews.Title: Nice shots
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Hamilton
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really nice shots if you are an armature (like me). We took it on a family vacation to the zoo, got all the pictures of the animals we wanted, plugged it into the computer and uploaded the pics to my favorite pic sharing site in no time!

Reviews.Title: When i do a video and play back, i am not hearing anything, and there is a mic and speaker, what is the problem, all sounds r on
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Jaikaransingh "Ingrid"
Reviews.Content: Received camera in good condition, but when i do a video and play back, i am not getting any sounds, and all sounds r on, there is a microphone and speaker.Could u tell me what to do

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Josther Vasquez
Reviews.Content: Excelente, La recomiendo 100% muy buena hasta los momentos, tremenda resolucion, comprenla vale la pena la inversion saludos desde venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Dennis Jones
Reviews.Content: It is the best Camera I have ever used, simple, straight forward and easy to use. Big plus uses AA batteries

Reviews.Title: blue kodak
Reviews.Author: bluboy619
Reviews.Content: This Kodak is nice but I would like prefer to have a switch to select the mode but this camera overall is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great for camera for a young Peruvian
Reviews.Author: John E. Wente "okiebikinguy"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera as a gift to a young man in Peru. He absolutely loves it! I chose a camera that uses AA batteries because they are universally available, even in Peru. I gave him some rechargeable batteries and a charger, but when those wear out, if he can't find more rechargeables, he will at least still be able to use the camera with primary batteries. I was also able to find a Spanish language user's manual on-line, which I printed out and sent along with the camera. This really turned out great because, although he is leaning English, a camera manual is very difficult reading in a foreign language.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Camera Review Bought Through Amazon
Reviews.Author: Judee
Reviews.Content: I am most definitely a technology challenged individual (I struggled when they took away my Polaroid camera!) and have been MOST pleased with this Kodak digital camera.  I get good (and sometimes even great!) shots most every time, and even more - I know how to work it!  The supplier had it to me in short order and it was everything it was advertised to be.  Good job!

Reviews.Title: I love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Vera
Reviews.Content: I broke my nikon camera so I needed to buy a new camera to capture the little moments in life. This does just that. It is kind of laggy though.. it takes time between shots to adjust itself and because of this, I've missed some pics, but you couldn't get a better camera for this price

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Service
Reviews.Author: pete
Reviews.Content: Camera was delivered to me quite timely. This camera takes a great picture....very easy to use. And the batteries last a long time before they need to be re-charged......I am sooo glad I purchased this item!

Reviews.Title: A Very Fine Camera For So Little Money
Reviews.Author: Adam Busenlehner
Reviews.Content: I had never owned a digital camera before and wanted to start with a Point-and-Shoot camera. I bought this Kodak C1550 model on Amazon used for only $40.00 + a few more dollars for a 4GB memory card. I was shocked that it is only the size of a pack of cigarettes! It is very easy to take high quality pictures and just as easy to transfer the images to your home computer. The computer program then asks you if you would like to delete the images out of your camera as a convenience. I like that. All you do is connect the USB cable from your computer to the connection jack on the right side of the camera and the images are automatically copied into the "pictures" folder on your home computer. It couldn't be simpler. The video display on the rear of the camera is a large three inch screen. The camera has other capabilities I may never use, but it's good to know those features are there for the future. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: jseattle
Reviews.Content: Great quality pocket camera, especially for the price!  I am disappointed that Kodak will no longer be manufacturing digital cameras.  The only two features that I am not fond of on this model are the placement of the tripod socket on the far left of the camera base (instead of the middle) and burying the timer function in the "i" button (instead of a button for the timer on the camera itself).

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: jb
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare C1550 is named correctly. It was the easiest camera to use that I have found. I got it right the first time that I tried it which was a shock for me. I have been enjoying my camera ever since. The blue should be listed as blue/black because it is so dark but love the camera even if it was sky blue pink.

Reviews.Title: great choice
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with the new camera - this is the 3rd Kodak that I've had/used in the past year and this is by far the best in picture quality and has all the best features from the last two cameras and still at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: mnspry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures of my kids but am returning it because all the pictures came out blurry. Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Looks the same as my 10 mp KODAK
Reviews.Author: Harry Jordan
Reviews.Content: I love the cam I was hoping thay would change the bat door My old KODAK 10M P was grate but not good eng on that door.Small pice of plastic to hold the bat dooor closed? it broke.But I love that cam also! 16 M P WOW!!

Reviews.Title: nice for the price
Reviews.Author: jpwis
Reviews.Content: good camera, easy to use, prompt shipment, worry about warranty and service but who cares as long as we get a year or two out of it.

Reviews.Title: Insufficient Battery Life
Reviews.Author: JAWS
Reviews.Content: Arrived on schedule, Love the photos recently taken with this camera however be prepared this camera eats batteries. I have now purchased rechargeable batteries and will certainly send in my update, I'm hoping it will save and I will not have to purchase more batteries. Sad that it did not come with a manual on the different functions.

Reviews.Title: NO WEB SITE
Reviews.Author: patsykl
Reviews.Content: un able to get software to download picturesWeb site no longer availableWeb site is no longer availableInstructions for downloading do not work

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Alluundra
Reviews.Content: Got it as a gift, quick delivery and the person I gifted it to seems pretty happy with it. I am waiting for more pictures to know more.

Reviews.Title: No Video sound
Reviews.Author: candy
Reviews.Content: Unable to hear video when recording have to connect to computer to hear sound need to have more instructions inside you have to go online to read the maneul

Reviews.Title: Please just spare yourself
Reviews.Author: Aria
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nightmare. It will randomly take photos whether or not you hit the shutter button. The battery life isn't too bad, but the photo quality is. I already have a dead pixel with my camera, and all my photos come out very noisy and blurry no matter what setting I use. Now I'm not the most advanced photographer, but I've been doing this for a while. My friend however is an amazing photographer and even with his help I can't get this camera to function correctly. Long story short, just spend the extra $20-$40+ on a better camera if you want something small and easy like I did, it will be much more worth it and save you from hours of frustration.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't for crap
Reviews.Author: larry
Reviews.Content: Was barely able to figure out how to use this piece of crap. Was not user friendly and the picture quality wasnt as good as the Sony camera that I bought instead of keeping this camera. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA & BUYING ON AMAZOM.COM IS THE BEST!!!  THANK YOU! TO EVERYONE @ AMAZON FOR THE BEST VALUE & THE BEST SERVICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Ed Trzeciak
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS THE BEST CAMERA I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!!!& AMAZON.COM IS THE BEST for value & service  THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny Pinchansky
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera for a fair price!Good quality pictures !Easy share don't work!!!Your not previously been inform that the easy share it's not working anymore!!!

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Patty Gebhard
Reviews.Content: This has not work at all, when you take a picture with it and put the card in the printer in will not show the picture at all, we have tried many different card and they all do the same. If you plug it in to the printer it will come op with error// We would love to see if we could get this replace. Sorry it took so long to get back to you about this.. Put my Dad just tried it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C1550
Reviews.Author: Linnea D. Saputo
Reviews.Content: We are spoiled - we liked our first EasyShare -.  The first was excellent - this camera is NOT THE QUALITY OF THE FIRST CAMERA!!!

Reviews.Title: The worst camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Monther Omar
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the 16MP and the great zoom this camera have, because it won't work at the first place. I don't know why, but it seems that there is something wrong with the camera charging ability.So, thanks for screwin me Amazon
